name: Alternating Bicep Curls
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, keeping your palms facing towards you.
2. Keep your back straight, shoulders relaxed, and core engaged to maintain proper posture throughout the exercise.
3. Curl one arm, lifting the dumbbell up until it is at ear height or slightly above, keeping your upper arm still and only moving your forearm.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position without releasing it from your grip.
5. Immediately curl the other arm, following the same motion as step 3.
6. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.
7. Focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of each curl and keep your upper body steady.
short_summary: Alternating Bicep Curls is a strength training exercise that targets the biceps muscle and involves lifting dumbbells in an alternating pattern.
